title: iOMEGA Paired Omics Data Platform
description: This Paired Omics Data Platform is a community-based initiative standardizing links between genomic and metabolomics data in a computer-readable manner to further the field of natural products discovery. The form below aims to capture sufficient metadata to create informative links between genome sequences on the one hand and metabolomics profiles on the other hand. Note that wherever we could, we have used existing ontology to define terms. When filling out the form below, at any time the inputted data can be saved and downloaded in json format to be reloaded when continuing with the entries. The form below first asks for some personal information to provide proper credits and allow the community to ask the right person information on the linked data. Then, overall information on the metabolomics experiment is captured, before all genomes or metagenomes can be detailed, including creating a unique genome label for easy recall during linking. Then the metabolomics metadata can be saved using labels for sample growth conditions, extraction, and instrument methods. Finally, the data links can be made with references to the actual mass spectral files in MaSSIVE. Optionally, you can save links between known biosynthesis gene clusters and mass spectra or molecular families in the second part of the form. After saving your entries, a table below the form will appear filled with the links you created with experimental labels; you can also expand the table to see all information inputted. Then you can download the filled json schema in which all links are recorded. To accommodate inputting large datasets, you can download the TSV linking table, manually add new links, and re-upload the TSV file. It is important to note that all experimental labels need to be defined in the form and at least one link made before you download and edit the table. We hope you will use our platform to capture your paired data links as this will allow you and the community to efficiently use your data in follow-up studies that rely on the combined use of genome and metabolome data.

submitter_name.title: Name of contact for correspondence
submitter_name.description: This person will be the point of contact for any communication related to this entry.

submitter_orcid.title: ORCID identifier
submitter_orcid.description: ORCID identifier of person who is point of contact. Please use full ORCID iD, e.g. https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1825-0097 .

submitter_name_secondary.title: Name of second contact for correspondence
submitter_name_secondary.description: This person will be the second point of contact for any communication related to this entry.

PI_name.title: Name of the principal investigator of the submitter
PI_name.description: This person is contacted in case the submitters have moved institutions

PI_institution.title: Academic institution or company name
PI_institution.description: Please use the full, official name of your institute in English. E.g., 'Harvard University'.

metabolomics.title: 2. Metabolomics Information
metabolomics.description: Please provide basic information on the publicly available metabolomics project from which paired data is available. Currently, we allow for links to mass spectrometry data deposited in GNPS-MaSSIVE or MetaboLights.

GNPSMassIVE_ID.title: GNPS-MassIVE identifier
GNPSMassIVE_ID.description: Please provide the GNPS-MassIVE identifier of your metabolomics data set, e.g., MSV000078839.

MaSSIVE_URL.title: Link to MassIVE upload
MaSSIVE_URL.description: Please provide the link to the MassIVE upload, e.g., https://gnps.ucsd.edu/ProteoSAFe/result.jsp?task=a507232a787243a5afd69a6c6fa1e508&view=advanced_view. Warning, there cannot be spaces in the URI.

molecular_network.title: Molecular Network Task ID
molecular_network.description: If you have run a Molecular Network on GNPS, please provide the task ID of the Molecular Network job. It can be found in the URL of the Molecular Networking job, e.g., in https://gnps.ucsd.edu/ProteoSAFe/status.jsp?task=c36f90ba29fe44c18e96db802de0c6b9 the task ID is c36f90ba29fe44c18e96db802de0c6b9.

metabolights_study_id.title: MetaboLights study identifier
metabolights_study_id.description: Please provide the MetaboLights study identifier of your metabolomics data set, e.g. MTBLS307.

related_GNPSMassIVE_ID.title: Related GNPS-Massive identifiers
related_GNPSMassIVE_ID.description: Add other associated GNPS-MassIVE identifiers here, eg. MSV000078836,MSV000078839. For example, if you have data spread out over multiple MASSIVE datasets, reported in the same publication, you can add those related IDs here. If you used the same assays ("Sample Preparation," "Extraction Methods," and/or "Instrumentation Methods"), you can clone one project and make slight modifications (e.g. different Genome IDs) instead of entering the assay information again.

related_metabolights_study_id.title: Related Metabolights study identifiers
related_metabolights_study_id.description: Add other associated MetaboLights study identifiers here, eg. MTBLS727,MTBLS728. Similar to the related GNPS-Massive identifiers.

publications.title: Key publications
publications.description: Publications describing the metabolomics experiment and samples. Please input PubMed IDs (PMIDs, not PMCIDs!), separated by commas: e.g., '12000953,8843436'. Only enter numeric characters and commas. If a PMID is not available, a DOI can be entered instead (without the designation 'DOI' itself, e.g. '10.1039/c4sc01927j')

genomes.title: 3. (Meta)genomics Information
genomes.description: Please add all genomes and/or metagenomes for which paired data is available as separate entries.

genome_ID.title: Genome or Metagenome
genome_ID.description: Please select genome (microbial isolate grown in pure culture), metagenome (microbial mixture or environmental sample), or metagenome-assembled genome (genome assembled from a metagenome with no isolate grown in culture). All genome sequences must first be submitted to a public database with a unique identifier. In the case of a whole genome sequence, please use master records. At least one identifier must be entered.

GenBank_accession.title: GenBank accession number
GenBank_accession.description: If the publicly available genome got a GenBank accession number assigned, e.g., AL645882, please provide it here. The genome sequence must be submitted to GenBank/ENA/DDBJ (and an accession number must be received) before this form can be filled out. In case of a whole genome sequence, please use master records. At least one identifier must be entered.

BioSample_accession.title: BioSample accession number
BioSample_accession.description: If publicly available metadata is available at BioSamples, please provide the BioSample accession number, e.g. SAMEA3648350, here. We encourage depositing metadata following a standardized ontology to enable proper reuse of the data.

publications.title: Key publications
publications.description: Publications describing the sequencing of the genome or metagenome. Please input PubMed IDs (PMIDs, not PMCIDs!), separated by commas: e.g., '12000953,8843436'. Only enter numeric characters and commas. If a PMID is not available, a DOI can be entered instead (without the designation 'DOI' itself, e.g. '10.1039/c4sc01927j')

genome_label.title: Genome label
genome_label.description: Please assign a unique Genome Label for this genome or metagenome to help you recall it during the linking step. For example 'Streptomyces sp. CNB091'

experimental.title: 4. Experimental Details
experimental.description: Please provide basic information about the Sample Preparation, Extraction Methods, and Instrumentation Methods used. If different Sample Preparation, Extraction Methods, and/or Instrumentation Methods were used leading to different metabolomics data, please use separate entries for each experimental change and create a label that will help you recall the experimental parameters during the linking step. Experimental details can be attached to a metabolomics data file or a proteome.

sample_preparation.title: Sample Growth Conditions
sample_preparation.description: For strains grown in culture, please fill in the first five sections. For metagenomic samples, only metagenomic source is necessary.

medium_type.title: Medium type
medium_type.description: Please select liquid or solid medium.

metagenomic_sample_description.title: Metagenomic sample description
metagenomic_sample_description.description: Please describe your metagenomic sample preparation prior to extraction. This can include cell sorting or enrichment, drying, filtering, or other treatments.

metagenomic_environment.title: Metagenome host or isolation source
metagenomic_environment.description: For metagenomic samples, please select the source host or isolation source. If it is not available, please select Other and type it in.

medium.title: Growth medium
medium.description: Please select a growth medium used in the experiment. If it is not present, please select Other and type it in.

medium.title: Growth medium
medium.description: Please select a growth medium used in the experiment. If it is not present, please select Other and type it in.

Other_medium_link.title: URL for definition of other medium

metagenomic_other_environment.title: Name of other environment or host

growth_temperature.title: Temperature (℃)
growth_temperature.description: Please enter the temperature of growth in degrees Celsius.

growth_duration.title: Duration (h)
growth_duration.description: Please enter the growth duration in hours.

growth_phase_OD.title: Phase or OD
growth_phase_OD.description: Please enter the growth phase or optical density (OD) if you know it.

aeration_rpm.title: RPM
aeration_rpm.description: Rotations per minute of shaker or fermenter

aeration_rpm.title: RPM
aeration_rpm.description: Rotations per minute of shaker or fermenter

other_growth_conditions.title: Other growth conditions
other_growth_conditions.description: Please describe any other relevant or distinguishing growth conditions e.g. light 12h, dark 12h.  You can also define custom media here, indicate if purity checks were made, and provide more specific details.

sample_preparation_method.title: Sample Growth Conditions Label
sample_preparation_method.description: Please assign a Sample Growth Conditions Label for this set of sample preparation details. If more than one sample growth conditions was used, please create a new Sample Growth Conditions Label for each condition by clicking on the plus.

extraction_methods.title: Extraction Methods
extraction_methods.description: Please provide basic details about the extraction solvents and procedures used.

solvents.title: Extraction solvent
solvents.description: Please select the organic solvent used to extract the sample. If your sovent is not listed, please select Other and specify the solvent. If you used multiple solvents, please select them all and indicate the ratio.

ratio.title: Ratio
ratio.description: When a mixture of solvents was used, specify in which ratio each solvent was used. The ratios should sum up to 1.

resins.title: Resins
resins.description: Did you use resins in your extraction? If so, add the name of the resin here (e.g. XAD-2 or XAD-4). Otherwise, leave this section blank.

other_extraction_parameters.title: Other extraction details
other_extraction_parameters.description: Please describe any other relevant extraction methods, e.g. partitioned against water, fractionated with 20% acetonitrile, sequential extractions, used resins or storage manner (dried, liquid).

extraction_method.title: Extraction Method Label
extraction_method.description: Please assign an Extraction Method Label for this set of extraction details. If more than one extraction method was used, please create a new Extraction Method Label for each method by clicking on the plus.

instrumentation_methods.title: Instrumentation Methods
instrumentation_methods.description: Please provide basic information on the type of LCMS instrumentation and protocols used in this experiment. More detailed information can go in the 'Other' box. Including both metabolomics and proteomics (if proteomics data is included) instruments

instrument.title: Instrument type
instrument.description: Please select the type of LCMS instrument used. If your instrument type is not listed here, please select Other and specify.

column.title: Column phase
column.description: Please select column phase. You can add additional column details in the Other Instrumentation Information section below.

ionization_type.title: Ionization type
ionization_type.description: Please select the type of ionization used. If your ionization type is not listed here, please select Other and specify.

range.title: Mass range
range.description: Please enter the mass range collected in Da. For example `100-800` for a range from 100 Da to 800 Da

collision_energy.title: Collision energy
collision_energy.description: Please enter the collision energy. Do not forget the unit like KeV or NCE

buffering.title: Mobile phase conditions
buffering.description: Did you add anything to your mobile phase, e.g. 0.1% formic acid.

other_instrumentation.title: Other instrumentation information
other_instrumentation.description: Please enter any other relevant instrument or method details, such as gradient used, more column details, or any other relevant information.

instrumentation_method.title: Instrumentation method label
instrumentation_method.description: Please assign an Instrumentation Method Label for this set of instrumentation details. If more than one LCMS instrumentation method was used, please create a new Instrumentation Method Label for each condition by clicking on the plus.

proteomes.title: 5. Proteomics information
proteomes.description: Please add all proteomes for which paired data is available as separate entries. Create an entry for each different condition in your sample set

proteome_ID.title: Full proteome or enriched
proteome_ID.description: If proteomics experiment includes any enrichment processes in favour of target proteins, please select `Enriched` and provide target(s).

proteome_data_link.title: Location of raw proteomics data
proteome_data_link.description: Please provide link to public data depository where the proteomics data and metadata can be found. If the experiment is quantitative, please provide link to the expression table.

method.title: Basic method
method.description: Please provide basic criteria of proteomics experiment.

genome_database.title: Genome database
genome_database.description: The genome from which the predicted proteome database was generated, used to guide the parent ion selection. If no genome was used then keep field unselected.

transcriptomics_database.title: Transcriptomics database
transcriptomics_database.description: The transcriptome from which the predicted proteome database was generated, used to guide the parent ion selection. Please input a NCBI GEO database accession. For example GSE171784. If no transcriptome was used then keep field empty.

genome_database.title: Genome database
genome_database.description: The genome from which the predicted proteome database was generated, used in your protein identification process. If no genome was used then keep field unselected.

transcriptomics_database.title: Transcriptomics database
transcriptomics_database.description: The transcriptome from which the predicted proteome database was generated, used in your protein identification process. Please input a NCBI GEO database accession. For example GSE171784. If no transcriptome was used then keep field empty.

experimental_details.title: Experimental details
experimental_details.description: A proteome can have different experimental details than a metabolomics data file. If different add experimental details in section 4 and pick from list here.

sample_preparation_label.title: Sample Growth Conditions
sample_preparation_label.description: Please select the Sample Growth Conditions Label for this proteome.

instrumentation_method_label.title: Instrumentation Method
instrumentation_method_label.description: Please select the Instrumentation Method Label for this proteome.

publications.title: Key publications
publications.description: Publications describing the proteomics experiment. Please input PubMed IDs (PMIDs, not PMCIDs!), separated by commas: e.g., '12000953,8843436'. Only enter numeric characters and commas. If a PMID is not available, a DOI can be entered instead (without the designation 'DOI' itself, e.g. '10.1039/c4sc01927j')

notes.title: Additional notes
notes.description: If you have used a method that is in some aspects novel to the community, please specify here.

proteome_label.title: Proteome label
proteome_label.description: Please assign a unique proteome Label for this proteome to help you recall it during the linking step.

genome_metabolome_links.title: 6. Genome - Proteome - Metabolome Links
genome_metabolome_links.description: Create a linked pair by selecting the Genome Label and optional Proteome label as provided earlier. Subsequently links to the metabolomics data file belonging to that genome/proteome with appropriate experimental methods.

genome_label.title: Genome/Metagenome
genome_label.description: Please select the Genome Label to be linked to a metabolomics data file.

proteome_label.title: Proteome
proteome_label.description: Please select the Proteome Label to be linked to a metabolomics data file.

metabolomics_file.title: Location of metabolomics data file
metabolomics_file.description: Please provide a direct link to the metabolomics data file location, e.g. ftp://massive.ucsd.edu/MSV000078839/spectrum/R5/CNB091_R5_M.mzXML found in the FTP download of a MassIVE dataset or https://www.ebi.ac.uk/metabolights/MTBLS307/files/Urine_44_fullscan1_pos.mzXML found in the Files section of a MetaboLights study. Warning, there cannot be spaces in the URI.

sample_preparation_label.title: Sample Growth Conditions
sample_preparation_label.description: Please select the Sample Growth Conditions Label for this linked metabolomics dataset.

extraction_method_label.title: Extraction Method
extraction_method_label.description: Please select the Extraction Method Label for this linked metabolomics dataset.

instrumentation_method_label.title: Instrumentation Method
instrumentation_method_label.description: Please select the Instrumentation Method Label for this linked metabolomics dataset.

BGC_MS2_links.title: 7. Biosynthetic Gene Cluster - MS/MS Links
BGC_MS2_links.description: If you already know of a biosynthetic gene cluster or biosynthetic gene cluster family that can be linked to a molecule or molecular family, please provide details in this section. Biosynthetic gene clusters can be found in MIBiG.

known_link.title: Known linked gene cluster and molecule
known_link.description: Please provide a brief description of the known linked molecule(s) and gene cluster(s), including the name of the molecule(s).

verification.title: Link verification
verification.description: Please indicate if verification of the link between BGC and MS2 is experimentally validated or bioinformatically inferred.

enum: Experimentally validated with knockouts, heterologous expression, or other gene cluster manipulation
Bioinformatically inferred through comparative analysis with another experimentally defined gene cluster
Experimentally validated with NMR and/or detailed MS/MS analysis

omics_based_evidence.title: Verified with additional experimental omics-based evidence

omics_based_evidence_type.title: Type
omics_based_evidence_type.description: Select which omics-based experiment type has given evidence of link between BGC cluster and molecule.

evidences.title: Quantitative evidences
evidences.description: Describe quantitative evidences between control and experimental.

control_group.title: Control group
control_group.description: Please select the proteome label for the control group.

experimental_group.title: Experimental group
experimental_group.description: Please select the proteome label for the experimental group.

metabolite_concentration.title: Change in metabolite concentration
metabolite_concentration.description: Change in metabolite concentration between control and experimental group

genome.title: Source genome
genome.description: Select the genome label from which the protein was translated.

protein_database.title: Protein database
protein_database.description: Database in which protein identifier of protein can be found.

protein_identifier.title: Protein identifier
protein_identifier.description: Identifier of protein which changed between control and experiment. When public identifier (Uniprot or RefSeq) is available then please fill in the public identifier. When public identifier is not available then please fill in a custom identifier.

protein_fold.title: Protein fold
protein_fold.description: Change seen in protein between control and experimental group

protein_fold_change.title: Log2 fold change
protein_fold_change.description: Protein log<sub>2</sub> transformed fold change: experiment group / control group.

quantitation_type.title: Quantitation type
quantitation_type.description: What quantiation was used for the protein fold change

SMILES.title: Simplified molecular-input line-entry system (SMILES)
SMILES.description: Please provide the SMILES notation for the known molecule.

IUPAC.title: International union of pure and applied chemistry (IUPAC) name
IUPAC.description: Please provide the IUPAC name for the known molecule,

enum: MIBiG number associated with this exact BGC
MIBiG number of a similar BGC from a closely related strain
BGC.default: MIBiG number associated with this exact BGC

enum: MIBiG number associated with this exact BGC
MIBiG number of a similar BGC from a closely related strain

strain.title: Strain accession number
strain.description: Please provide the strain accession number of the genome containing the similar BGC.

coordinates.title: BGC Coordinates
coordinates.description: Please provide the beginning and end coordinates of the similar BGC from the genome specified above.

link.title: What would you like to link?

network_nodes_URL.title: GNPS network nodes URL
network_nodes_URL.description: Please provide the URL from GNPS for the network nodes page: first click 'View Spectral Families (In Browser Network Visualizer)' and then click 'Network Nodes' and copy this URL, e.g. https://gnps.ucsd.edu/ProteoSAFe/result.jsp?view=cluster_info_sliced&componentindex=290&show=true&task=c36f90ba29fe44c18e96db802de0c6b9#%7B%7D

MS2_URL.title: Mass spectrometry fragmentation file
MS2_URL.description: Please provide the URL to a mzML/mzXML/MGF/MSP file for the mass spectrum with the molecule to link. Warning, there cannot be spaces in the URI.

MS2_scan.title: Mass spectrometry fragmentation scan number
MS2_scan.description: Please provide the MS2 scan number for the molecule to link.
